title: P-values
description: This quiz helps you review p-values, significance, and how to interpret null hypothesis significance testing.

questions.question: A researcher has run their analyses, comparing an experimental drug to a placebo (a independent samples t-test) on number of depressive symptoms, and their t-test gives this result: t = 5.98, p = .024. What do you conclude?
options: significant p-value, reject the null, drug and placebo are different
significant p-value, fail to reject the null, drug and placebo are not different
not significant p-value, reject the null, drug and placebo are not different
not significant p-value, fail to reject the null, drug and placebo are different

questions.question: In social sciences, the p-value is compared to an alpha of .05 because...
options: we have agreed as a field to a 5% chance of making a type 1 error
we want to look at the 5% most likely results
we have agreed as a field to a 5% chance of making a type 2 error
because it represents the alpha-omicron divide

questions.question: If a researcher measures self-esteem and social media usage (on a scale of 1-10), and get a pearson correlation of, r = .45, p = .012, they can conclude...
options: significant p-value, fail to reject null, no evidence of a relationship
non-significant p-value, fail to reject null, evidence of a relationship
non-significant p-value, reject null, no evidence of a relationship
significant p-value, reject null, evidence of a relationship
